p: The results of the contact toxicities of the EOs of X. discreta, L. stoechas, S. viminea, M. septentrionalis, P. el-metanum, P. nubigenum, P. cf. asperiusculum, P. pertomentellum, and C. album presented in this work constitute the first reports of these activities for the mentioned oils on S. zeamais. For the EOs of P. aduncum, C. citratus, C. nardus, O. basilicum, R. officinalis, C. sempervirens and L. alba, it has been reported that they exert contact toxicity against the insect of interest, with LD 50 less than 0.5 ÂµL/cm 2 in contact tests with treated surfaces [ 42, 43, 44].
